website_summaries.verdict: The best overall mouse pad to pick when you want extra precision and performance.
pros: A uniquely patterned surface provides greater contrast for optical mice
Speeds up performance and smooths out movement
Extends the life of wireless mice
cons: Doesn't lie flat on a table

customer_reviews.title: Leaves residue from mouse
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this mousepad for over a year. I use it with a Logitech M720. For some reason, which I can't figure out why, the texture of this mouse pad eats away at the rubber/plastic bottom to my mouse. Everything is clean - it's not mold or debris. The bottom of my mouse has been worn smooth. The black spots on the mousepad can easily be scraped off - and it comes off sort of in the same way that the scratcher on a lottery ticket does. So it's easy to clean - but it just comes back immediately. It looks gross enough looking that I'm probably going to end up getting a different mouse pad, which is unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Not for use with apple mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Not for use with an Apple Mouse. I have two pads and use with two different apple mice and both have the sane issue. The surface of the pad has a texture that rubs off the black strip on the bottom of the mouse which balls up and sticks to the pad. It had to be cleaned daily as the black stick on blobs interferes with the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Makai

customer_reviews.title: Good,  but needs airing out!
customer_reviews.text: Great item, looks clean with its simple design, and works great with an optical mouse. One problem though is that it smells like freshly laid asphalt or like burning rubber. The smell went away after 2 weeks, but it was quite acrid and it took me a while to realize there was not construction happening nearby, it was just the mouse pad off-gassing. Not ideal, but it was so cheap i can't complain. Good value overall. Update: I completely forgot that the pad was off-gassing because it did go away completely. :-) Great pad and months later, I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AJB

customer_reviews.title: Strong Chemical Smell (update)
customer_reviews.text: Strong, foul chemical odor that you could smell from two rooms away. I threw mine outside to see if the smell will subside. Packaging is porous paper, so I doubt it the odor will get better anytime soon. (Update: increased from 2 to 3 stars) After leaving outside for one week, the smell subsided. Now just has a faint rubbery smell (like a new tennis shoe). It is useable. I do like the surface and the way the mouse feels on it. Still shouldn't arrive in a smelly state. 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: chaw704352

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges that make you wish you were using cardboard instead.
customer_reviews.text: By a wide margin, the Most uncomfortable thing I've ever laid my wrist on. The edges dig into your wrist and leave a mark. It's so rough and sharp, yet says no where on here that it's a semi hard mouse pad. The top is textured and kinda feels like a pliable plastic material. I thought it was just a design that helped, but no, it's pretty solid. If your light with your hands probably will be fine, but I rest my wrist as I scroll and it became unbearable the same day I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kalen

customer_reviews.title: Its an inexpensive mousepad....
customer_reviews.text: It's an inexpensive mousepad, not rocket science! What are you expecting? There's nothing revolutionary here, just a soft, flexible pad to rub your mouse on. It's easy to wipe clean, the color is neutral, and the price is right--and it's not some cheesy thing your kid brought home from the elementary school gift shopping day with a unicorn and a rainbow. I'd call that a win. If criminal ninjas break into my house tonight and steal this mousepad, I will use the insurance payout to buy another just like it. Because ninjas, damn.
customer_reviews.author: C. B. Manges

customer_reviews.title: Horrible smell - 6 weeks later
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these (desktop, laptop and one for my office. They work great but they smell terrible. Toxic chemical smell that I smell as I work and stays on my hand if I work with my mouse for awhile. Ugh! I tried putting them outdoors in the sun to off-gas for a few hours. It helped a little, but I can still smell while I work. I thought I couldn't go wrong with 3M. I can't stand it anymore. I hope I can still return them for something that doesn't smell like it's killing me.
customer_reviews.author: caitiekay

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth checking out!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse pad. I've been a user of wireless optical mice when the receiver was at least 1-2 ft long, and I stopped using mouse pads because I felt it was too much trouble carrying one around. Anyway, I had to get a mousepad last year when I started using a portable glass desk by my couch. The bad thing about that is you have to use a opaque surface to use an optical mouse. I love this mouse pad because it's very simplistic and it doesn't interfere with the mouse's "ability"? I guess it does help the battery life because I've been using this mouse and same battery for at least 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wu

customer_reviews.title: Had to bring this down from 5 stars down to 1
customer_reviews.text: This pad was GREAT when i first got it. Unfortunately a little less than 5 months later it has a large bald spot. Nice and smooth area that the mouse looses signal on so it stutters at times and at other times it just freezes till i find a spot that has texture and jumps around. i had thought i found the perfect mouse pad, unfortunately i did not.
customer_reviews.author: Edzew Kurai

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse pad ever
customer_reviews.text: It's odd to say that I have found the best mouse pad ever. The diamond-like print on the mouse pad makes your mouse super sensitive. I have all three sizes. I do have the smallest 3M mouse pad. It's more like a post-it note. It has a sticky back that you can slap on your laptop cover. And then remove it and place it on the table/desk when you need it. I cannot comment or review on saving on the mouse battery. I have never had a problem with my mouse running out of juice, but it does make the pointer/cursor very sensitive. That's a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Killion

customer_reviews.title: Awful, Overpowering Odor!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad has an awful chemical smell. I simply can't use it and now, I can't return it because we threw away the box. My son opened it for me so I didn't know there was an issue until later that night. Please, don't ask me to call CS, plenty of people have the same review I have from a long time ago... nothing has been done to fix it by now so my call won't help anything. The odor isn't "slight" either, it's overpowering!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy2TwoBoys

customer_reviews.title: Seems to extend battery life
customer_reviews.text: I'm replacing my old review, in which I said that the battery-saving feature seemed to work at first and then not at all as the pad got worn. Actually, I now think that my rechargeable batteries were bad. I switched to a different set and now I get good battery runtime with this pad. FWIW, I examined the pad for wear after a few months of use and the edges still have the original texture, while the middle area where the mouse is used has been worn smooth and bald. This can't be seen visually, it's a tactile difference.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bluejay

customer_reviews.title: The mouse pad does increase my mouse precision
customer_reviews.text: When my mouse pad arrived, it had a bad smell associated with it. I tried washing it only to notice it had a water repelling oil coating on it. The rubber bottom part had the oil on it and it kept sliding on my desk. I used goo be gone and separated the upper plastic part from the lower rubber part and glued the plastic part right on my Formica desktop. The plastic part still had a sticky gluey bottom where I separated it and so it doesn't move or have a bad smell. I threw the smelly separated bottom part away (pee yew). It works as a precision mouse pad so I gave it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Albert T.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, smelly, damages easily.
customer_reviews.text: Smells terribly of plastic, even almost 2 months later. Every time I pick it up, the whole room fills with the scent. Heat warps it easily. Just one hot bowl of soup crinkled it on the edges. It gets dirty easily, and stuff sticks to it. It already has deep scratches from my mouse. I'm already replacing it. Otherwise, it is a mouse pad. It is cheap, but hopefully I don't get cancer from having this terrible chunk of smelly plastic under my hand for 2 months. Then it won't be so cheap. For the people who made it, I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: slick but sharp
customer_reviews.text: the edge on this is very sharp. they could have rounded it a bit, these are stamped from a larger sheet, and it feels it. i could scrape frost off of glass with the edge. the surface is smooth, so smooth i had to slow my mouse to compensate. but as others pointed out, it gets crummy? crumbs seem to get under the mouse on this, which is annoying. so you have to stop and scrape it down. but it does make the laser mouse more responsive. it makes it smooth but not ice smooth, i've tried glass, but that was way too slick, it would wander around on its own.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoKing

customer_reviews.title: They last about 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased one of these last September. It took a little getting used to how slick it was but I soon came to favor it over all other mousepads. Lately though, it had started feeling a lot less slick and even a bit "draggy", when cleaning it didn't help I carefully examined the surface and saw that my mouse had worn it shiny smooth, instead of the fine texture it comes with and that's what was causing the mouse to drag and stick. I ordered two new replacements and got them today, June 26th. One will be a spare and the other will go directly into service.
customer_reviews.author: B.W. Behling

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, uncomfortable edges make it unusable
customer_reviews.text: My immediate reaction is "ouch". The edges of the mouse pad are SHARP! Sharp enough that you could get a paper, er, mouse pad cut on your wrist. NOT a great design. Looks nice, surface seems fine, but sharp edges make it unusable. ********* Addendum: Used 3M (ironically) coarse sandpaper to radius the sharp edge on the wrist side so pad could be used. Pad is doing what a pad should. Will post later if surface wears quickly as other reviewers have noted.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Nice But Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these from Amazon as we needed 2 pads for our wireless mouses. I find they are nice but seem to be a little slippery as I have had my mouse slide off several times. I think they are a good quality and unsure if they really save on battery life but will update this review one way or the other. My husband seems to be impressed with his and they are a lot nicer than the standard flat heavy ones. A little pricey in my opinion but still use them. We are not gamers so maybe it would be great if you play serious games with it. Still Amazon had the best price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Runyon

customer_reviews.title: Nice size but too smooth and slippery
customer_reviews.text: The mousepad is nice looking and a good size. The backing is rubber, is very well made, and sticks solidly sticks to the keyboard tray. The problem is the surface. It is so smooth and slippery that the mouse tends to move a little when clicking a button. This becomes frustrating when resizing a window as you try putting the mouse on the corner and clicking, just to have it slide a tiny bit. I'm thinking of using high grit sandpaper, probably 1,000 or higher, to rough it up just a little. I know it might mess it up completely but I might be willing to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: DaveSam

customer_reviews.title: Okay at best - possibly better than no mouse pad depending on your desk surface
customer_reviews.text: If you prefer high mouse sensitivity then look for a classic fabric-top mouse pad. The mouse pad does not allow the mouse to move 100% freely, so precise movements aren't easily done. This one almost "sticks" when you aren't moving the mouse more than a very short distance. It takes some extra effort to push it out of a stopped point, which means the target is overshot once it becomes unstuck. It also got a bend/crease in the top plastic that is a permanent ridge/bump now, which is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: J.F.Tidwell

customer_reviews.title: A Good Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these mouse pads for 2 reasons. First, they are made by 3M which has a rep for quality products. Second, they are supposed to extend the battery life of the wireless mouse. I don't know about the latter since I have only been using them about 2 months. However, they are well padded, easy on the eyes, and allow for precision cursor movement so I give them an "A" for quality. Also, I don't doubt they will give great battery life as advertised. I am happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: jjflash15

customer_reviews.title: This pad does not work
customer_reviews.text: I startedd to notice that none of mice were working well. I checked the batteries, cleaned the old mouse pad and cleaned the lense in the mouse. Nothing seemed to help. So I bought this mouse pad. It is far worse than the old pad when using any of the four mice in my house. I found an old mouse pad that I got from eBay for free. It works very well with all four Logitech mice. Proof that there is something drastically wrong with the new pad.
customer_reviews.author: dennisal

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect with the Apple Magic Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have an Apple Magic Mouse and suspect that the optics of the mouse are somewhat unique in that this mouse pad works well, most of the time, but there are still instances where the cursor stutters, stops, hesitates, or does not track well. I found that my mouse still works best directly on the wood laminate of my desk. I was hoping the unique pattern of this mouse would indeed support tracking accuracy, but that does not seem to be the case. Maybe this mouse pad would work better with a different mouse. With an Apple Magic Mouse, however, accuracy is (unfortunately) not consistent.
customer_reviews.author: G West

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad lives in a backpack with a travel mouse, to accompany a laptop that gets dragged around all kinds of places. Since there isn't always a smooth surface to use, the mouse pad is really helpful. It's a little stiffer than a lot of mouse pads which works really well for travel. It can stay vertical in the backpack without crushing. It has a smooth surface and thick, dense padding.
customer_reviews.author: WasabiZee

customer_reviews.title: Good product but horrible smell
customer_reviews.text: I hate to give one star to a product that I think is great. My problem is that it came reeking of insecticide. I washed it with soap and water several times, left it out in the rain and in the sun, washed it in soap and water again, to no avail. I had to throw it away. The spot on my desk on which it sat now reeks of insecticide too. I think I'll go to Staples and do a sniff test before I buy.
customer_reviews.author: Richmond Roe

customer_reviews.title: works great, arrived fast
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mouse pad. It may sound silly but a mouse pad is a serious tool and I hate things that make what I'm doing more difficult. Good quality is important no matter what I'm doing. The mouse reads this thing super fast, I actually had to slow down my track speed a bit because it was working so well. It's also a good size and slim which I also appreciate. If you think your current mouse pad is just fine, I urge you to try this one and see what you've been missing.
customer_reviews.author: T. Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a mouse pad for my Apple Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I just started a new job and they use Mac's and the mouse pad they sent me was awful, the mouse would skip and not track, it was very frustrating. I tried other pads I had around and one with a harder surface worked okay, but still lost connection and was driving me nuts. I did a lot of searching and found this mouse pad and it's amazing. The mouse doesn't skip or track at all. It whizzes around with ease and my work life is so much better now! I strongly recommend this for Apple mice :)
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen N

customer_reviews.title: Works really well!
customer_reviews.text: My one regret is not buying this sooner. I have an optical mouse but for some reason does not work well on my shinny black table surface. My colleague had similar issues and recommended I get this mouse pad. I decided to give it a try and am very happy about it. The mouse now works so much better and I do not have to slide it as far to get from one edge of the screen to the other. I would recommend this mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Alex W

customer_reviews.title: Gets dirty and makes mouse stop working
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my work desk with an optical mouse. I’ve now ordered two of these mousepads and will not order more. They get tiny bits of nearly invisible “gunk” on them that constantly makes my mouse skip and jump. I don’t know if it’s just dirt/dust or something from the rubber on my mouse but it is incredibly annoying. I have to clean and scrape it with my fingernails several times a day. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: SarahM

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Fast - But cheeped now
customer_reviews.text: I've worked with a mouse for many years at home and at work. I could not believe how responsive the mouse was after getting and using this mouse pad. Regardless of any price this is the best performing pad I have ever owned. New order August 26, 2020 I've changed my review from 5 stars because the pad is now less than half the thickness. It came bent and wont lay flat. Very disappointing for such what was a fantastic mouse pad to have been cheapened. Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: steve l

customer_reviews.title: An excellent mousepad but it really has a terrible chemical odor
customer_reviews.text: It has an odor that will be very offensive to some users. Imagine being in the paint booth of an auto body shop. It is the smell of volatile and possibly noxious chemicals. After a week, it is still pretty bad. I'm going to set it outside for a time and see if it gets any better. This problem so unfortunate considering that this mouse surface it excellent. Just don't get your face too close to it. Your eyes will water.
customer_reviews.author: Just JimTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my foam rubber mousepad which had a very comfortable extra pad for resting my wrist on. But the mouse performance had become very sluggish on that one. This one alleviated that problem immediately. It makes my optical mouse quick and responsive again. Time will tell how long this one will keep its friction integrity. But so far I'm very happy with it and it was a smart purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John S Harris

customer_reviews.title: Mouse Precision
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad absolutely, positively increased the precision of the mouse. Hand movement translates directly and linearly into on-screen mouse position. Solved all my problems with optical mice. I picked up another (for the laptop bag) after trying one, and am delighted. Disregard 1-star reviews for genuine article! I read poor reviews for odor issues. If they got a smelly mousepad it's because it was a knock-off. The genuine article is odor-free and does not vent VOCs. It is durable and high quality. Just think about that a minute. When was the last time anyone saw a poorly executed (genuine) 3M product? Right around Never.
customer_reviews.author: PT in TX

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews have said positive things about this mouse pad but the only positive thing I can say about it is the slick surface can be sanitized. My wireless optical mouse does NOT work with it. I replaced it with a pad from Victsing (through Amazon) which works perfectly. It has a cloth surface which is not easily sanitized but I am using it with my home computer so cleaning is not a concern to me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: precise mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: this is supposed to be a mouse pad that works especially well with a wireless mouse. it doesn't work at all! The reason I got it was because I was having trouble with the mouse on the kitchen table etc... but it turns out they worked better. the computer doesn't even sense the mouse at all. CORRECTION!! It may have been the most that I bought which was brand new. Because I just bought another mouse pad and that didn’t work either but with my other mouse it worked great. So ignore my review
customer_reviews.author: Debi LN

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pad even at this price
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad will make you wonder why you even used one of those cheap, but many faceted motif, pads. It is designed to WORK with a mouse, not just be a pretty cushion.for a mouse. The mouse glides over it and almost never (for the mouse cursor on the screen too) looses contact with the pad. The only reason I took one star off for ergonomics was that it's the standard size, bigger would be useful (for me). The best (functioning) mouse pad I have ever had in over 30 years of computer usage.
customer_reviews.author: David Smartz

customer_reviews.title: 2nd of 3 pads reviewed
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I had a mediamate (?) hard plastic mousepad, tapered. It was excellent but not working with my optical mouse any longer. I got 3 to test, 3M patterned, 2020 calendar and the Aluminum mirror finished/metal pad. I tried all three and selected the metal pad. The metal pad was thinner but tracked better with my movements. The other two were standard cheapo rubber backed mousepads. They got 4 stars. I am going to cross post this review on all 3.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Wears down fast
customer_reviews.text: Product was nice at first but the center has eroded and become “slick” after 5 months of use. The outer edges still have the texturized feeling which enables smooth mouse movement but who is gonna use the edge of a mousepad
customer_reviews.author: TostadaJ.

customer_reviews.title: Strong Odor
customer_reviews.text: The product gave off a strong product odor that permeated the entire room. The back of the product is made of a rubber surface. When I touched the surface, the odor transferred to my hand. This is my second 3M pad purchase. The first order from more than a year ago did not have this same odor.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: good quality and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: This pad works very well with my Logitech G500 and my gaming mouse (the brand name eludes me right now). I am not a competitive gamer so I cannot say how well it would work for that...but I do a lot of work and strategy games and this pad is perfect for this. It is a little slick and my only improvement recommendation would be a tad more resistance for a nicer feel.
customer_reviews.author: Jrod

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: Hi, after trial and error of a mouse mad that actually worked... I bought this one in a last ditch attempt at satisfaction and performance. It is perfect... my logitech mouse reads the boundaries of this one very well... and stays with in the limits. Other pads frustrated me to no end, as I was having to travel off the pad to select items at the very bottom or top of screen. Excellent. No more frustration. Learn from my trial.
customer_reviews.author: R. Powers

customer_reviews.title: Stinks, literally. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read the 1-star reviews before ordering this product. Unfortunately my past favorable experience with 3M mouse pads resulted in my skipping this crucial step. 3M should be ashamed of itself for putting its name on this product. It smells like what comes out of your car when you go 20K miles between oil changes. It should not be necessary to let a mouse pad air out for a few weeks before using it (if in fact a few weeks is enough). If you like this design, get the one with the adhesive strips. Skip the toxic-waste foam. Your olfactory lobes will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Unhinged

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pad!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my apple wireless mouse was barely working on any surface. I couldn't believe how my mouse worked perfectly after I started using it on this. Sadly that only lasted about a week and then I started having the same problem. If I cleaned this pad with rubbing alcohol I could get the mouse to work for a short period of time but then it wouldn't work again. STRANGE! Finally, I gave up and bought a used, wired apple mouse and now I am zipping right along with this pad and no more needing to wipe it down!! I think this is a great pad and it was just my temperamental wireless mouse!
customer_reviews.author: gsugar

customer_reviews.title: Bitmap Surface -- Smooth As Silk !
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love ?? The 3M pad grips very well to smooth or textured surfaces. There's no "sticky stuff" on the bottom. Bitmap surface allows your mouse to glide smoothly with no jerkiness. Excellent response for optical mouse -- superior to all others we've tried before. 8" x 9" size accomodates 24" monitors with ease. Repels dust and moisture to maintain smooth mouse action. After trying it for a week, I'm ordering another one for Dear Wife's computer station.
customer_reviews.author: Rust Never Sleeps

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mouse pad because I had just switched to a wireless mouse that was not working well with my old mouse pad. Since switching to this pad, it is registering my movement much better. Only complaint is the mouse pad does slide a little, could be the wooden desk I am using it on, just wish the back was a little tackier. Overall happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: NOT better than your desktop
customer_reviews.text: I liked...nothing. Forget that it came folded in the package and that it's still folded (see photo). Forget that it has a brand logo on top. (Lame.) The problem is that it doesn't do what they claim. There is no "enhanced precision" whatsoever. My optical mouse performs better, smoother and with more precision on my typical, ordinary white desktop. This is an old-school mousepad with zero advantages. And in my case, negative advantages. Sorry, 3M. You are not innovative. I'm not even sure if you're honest.
customer_reviews.author: reefbreak

customer_reviews.title: Great surface, sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: The surface of this mouse pad is very good. but the edges are sharp and it is not comfortable to use. I have tried to position my wrist in a way to avoid the edge, but to do so makes your wrist ache after a while. I would give it a five if it wasn't for the edges. They need to be turned down to avoid skin from rubbing against them. I am going to look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Manley

customer_reviews.title: A very nice mousepad
customer_reviews.text: This pad has a pattern that helps the mouse track really well and saves battery life. That would be more helpful for someone who games a lot. I play a few games, but I also have several other things to do. I have had no problem with it. It is close to 2 millimeters thick. They don't make mouse pads as thick anymore, but this one despite being relative thin, will last for at least a decade, it's that durable. Mine is probably up to 6 years old, and has very little wear, and the price is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Hippocamp

customer_reviews.title: sturdy mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a more sturdy mouse pad. The other was too soft on an uneven surface. This one is solid enough to provide a more level surface to scroll over. UPDATE: I have used the new mouse pad for a few days. I like that it has a sturdy shape. The mouse glides nicely over the surface. And this pad stays in place on the desk.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Strong, strong odor
customer_reviews.text: Very Strong Odor- it has been on my porch since I bought it but the smell has yet to dissipate. UPDATE: This product is still on my porch and it STILL smells strongly of chemicals. I have been continuing to use my old ratty Mouse Pad because it has NO odor. This product also has a smooth surface.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Q.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is very nice. The top side has a nice two tone silver and gray unique design. The mouse glides very easily across the surface. The surface is very lightly textured allowing the mouse to slide easily and at the same time it assures the mouse doesn't lose contact with the surface. The underside is a black textured rubber keeping it in place even on a glass surface. I recommend this mouse pad for those who do photo editing because if it's ability to let the mouse glide in a precise manner.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie910

customer_reviews.title: Smells horrible, for a good while
customer_reviews.text: This thing at first made my house smell wherever I put it, tried to let it air outside for a bit... week and a half later, still smells terrible. I read the reviews that it worked really great with a mouse so I bought it looking for an upgrade. Just tried using it, there is nothing special about it at all... should’ve just stuck with my cheap conference swag mousepad
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Great at first
customer_reviews.text: I loved this mouse pad when I first got it. It was easy to use, my optical mouse moved well and it was responsive. Over time, the center has "worn down" and is now smooth to the touch where the sides are still slightly textured. The mouse does not move as well, it is now "sticky" and not responsive. I am now looking for a new mouse pad after less than a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: MonadnockGirl

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely REEKS of rubber.
customer_reviews.text: While cheap and works relatively well, the smell is absolutely terrible. It will leave the palms of your hands smelling like rubber, and will also transfer the smell to the desktop it is on. I have tried numerous techniques to remove the smell such as vinegar, baking soda, detergent, and leaving it out in the sun... But the smell is still very potent. I guess I will just have to wait for the smell to fade away on its own - so far it has been a month, and the smell is still there, albeit not as strong. Perhaps in a few more months it will be more tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Optical Mice Require Special Mouse Pads.  They wont work on monochrome surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: Throw out your old mouse pads unless you are using a 1990's style roller mouse. Optical mice require changes of color on the pad in order to know that it is moving. I found out that using an optical mouse pad actually doubles your mouse battery life. Once I started using it, my mouse problems were gone.
customer_reviews.author: SD Sportsman

customer_reviews.title: Texture Wears Down and Will Fail
customer_reviews.text: My pad lasted for three years of normal use, but the textured surface bumps wore down after three years in the central 80% area of the pad. The mouse no longer functions well on the remaining smoother surface. There is a noticeable increase in friction as well, regardless of how often the pad and mouse are cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Cedarspring

customer_reviews.title: A great addition
customer_reviews.text: I started with the same version of the pad but with an adhesive backing. Well the adhesive attracted other stuff and I'm trying to find a way to clean it off. This one is just as good and great for you base station where you done move around a lot. Still I would not hesitate to pitch it in my laptop bag on my way out of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Colegate V. Spinks

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The product smells like new tires. This out gassing can be hazardous to your health. I placed some baking soda between two paper towels and placed it under the mouse pad it helped absorb the odor and out gassing. My mouse was not impressed with the surface of this pad, instead of gliding is got stuck. I would recommend cleaning the optical lens of your mouse if it gets stuck, mine needed a good cleaning and is working happily with this mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pad
customer_reviews.text: Since I started using this pad I have only grown to like it more & more. it is a perfect size. The surface is nice to touch and my mouse glides so easily. I can't comment on battery life but it makes sense that the lighter surface requires less energy to register. I am also noticing ith mouse moves with much less resistance. All in all, it is a super great pad
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Decker

customer_reviews.title: I would advise against buying this unless you have extremely good ventilation in your home or office
customer_reviews.text: I can't review this product based on function because I never used it. The chemical smell was so strong that I could not keep it in my house. It went out with today's trash pick up. I would advise against buying this unless you have extremely good ventilation in your home or office.
customer_reviews.author: eh

customer_reviews.title: It's a great mouse pad especially for this price!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great mouse pad especially for this price! It feels so good, I just got mine so I can't really talk about the marks I read on others reviews but for now it looks really decent mouse pad and my mouse moves perfectly. Great size and great look. Its go along with MacBook Pro 2020 space grey!!! Really satisfied. Worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Rafinha_Matos

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty good mousepad
customer_reviews.text: You know what? This is a pretty great mousepad. I used to use nothing but wired mice because optical ones had such poor precision in the past and I hate changing batteries. I'm not sure if this pad really can save on batteries, but my mouse scoots well on it. It's also thin enough not to become an obstruction on my desk. I never though I'd pay money for a mousepad, but this was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Niemla

customer_reviews.title: Something that works as stated.
customer_reviews.text: Really works with Arteck rechargeable mouse. I can get 5-6 days of use before recharge. Before it was 3-4 days. The reason for the 4 stars is that the texturing on the pad is slowly rubbing off, leaving lumps of ? on the pad and the bottom of the mouse, and because of the cheap mouse, precision can't be measured.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Maloy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: My optical mouse was not working on a new wooden desktop. So I bought a (very) cheap mouse pad with a silly design from Walmart. The mouse worked no better. So, I came to Amazon and found this 3M Precise Mouse Pad. I bought 2 just in case it worked well since I have 2 computers with these mice. The mice work perfectly on these pads. No cursor skipping or jumping around. No cursor halting. 3M products are always excellent IMHO and this mouse pad is another of their superior products.
customer_reviews.author: Laura McGaffey

customer_reviews.title: Not for some older people
customer_reviews.text: I thought this mouse pad was cloth on top of a rubber foam base. I was wrong it is a flexible piece of plastic. The plastic extends past the foam base creating a sharp edge which I had to use sandpaper to remove because it was very uncomfortable to use. I prefer a cloth mouse pads because I am 58 and somewhat shaky so cloth works much better than super slick plastic for me.
customer_reviews.author: mm1

customer_reviews.title: Glides like ice!
customer_reviews.text: Was going to put it on my expense report at work so they would pay me back... but not anymore. Because when I leave this job I’m taking it with me! I had a gray standard material mouse pad. It was getting dirty. I bought this because it matches my office theme and was the hard surface. My mouse glides like it’s on ice! The tracking on the screen is so much faster!! I LOVE it. My co workers are jealous.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is not the mouse pad you are looking for
customer_reviews.text: Most annoying mouse pad I've ever used. My cursor keeps stalling and the mouse buttons just won't work, so I tried changing the batteries on my mouse. No change. If I put my mouse on my desk's plain surface, those problems all go away. Next stop for this mouse pad in the garbage can. I have no idea how this thing gets any 5-star ratings. Save yourself the trouble and your money. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shines

customer_reviews.title: Good friction for your mouse but it's a little too small
customer_reviews.text: The mousepad works pretty well for the price. Your computer should have no trouble recognizing the movements of your mouse once the bluetooth is connected. It's smooth, and it never give your wrist any trouble gliding across your screen. And it's incredibly inexpensive. My only complaint about it, is that it is relatively small. So there are times, depending on the size of your screen, where you may have to readjust the mouse to properly guide it all the way to your desired destination. But as I said, this is a minor complaint. All in all, for what it is, it's still a very good mousepad.
customer_reviews.author: Hannibal Rasberry

customer_reviews.title: It's not a soft "neoprene" printed type top surface, but a "plastic" type top surface.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good size and my mouse feels nice and accurate on it. Sadly, I didn't realize when I bought it that it's not a soft "neoprene" printed surface on top but one of the plastic/hard top mouse pads. I've never really been able to use mouse pads with that type of surface because I have sweaty hands and the unbreathable plastic top can make it uncomfortable for my wrist after any long amount of usage. My kids like it on their computer, but it's not for me.
customer_reviews.author: shaebee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sensitivity
customer_reviews.text: These mousepads are much better than I anticipated. They track very smoothly and have a sensitivity that was missing on other surfaces. This is a high quality product that works very well with Apple optical mouses. Side note: I received 5 mouse pads in this order, and didn't realize that I'd receive more than one.
customer_reviews.author: Poobah

customer_reviews.title: strong chemical odor, wasn't new
customer_reviews.text: Mouse pad was previously opened and had probably been returned because of the odor. Strong chemical smell noticeable from 6 ft away. Smell of the pad is too strong to use it. The pad is currently sitting outside for a few days to see if the odor goes away. If not, I'll dump it. Update - threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: This is the 2nd one I've bought, 1st one good..2nd one STINKS to high heavens.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these exact ones, a few years back. It worked great and smelled a tiny bit of rubber. But this one---OMG--talk about stink. I placed it upside down for a week to air it out, then on a radiator hoping to drive the smell out. Nope, still smells so bad that I cannot tolerate it in my office. Returned. No longer recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Stef603

customer_reviews.title: Don’t know how I lived without it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I had problems with my Apple Magic Mouse not registering movement with my last mousepad. This fixed it, now my mouse is super responsive! Definitely a must have for the office. I was hesitant because of the color but it adds contrast to my office (everything else is black).
customer_reviews.author: Greg Blake

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy, but it works
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my mouse was having a hard time on the wood of my desk and would occasionally skip around the screen or not register movement. The mouse pad helped a bit by providing a better surface for the laser. There isn't much padding so don't expect it to relieve any wrist or hand pain, but it's a good basic mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: B4E1

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad works great and I only have one very small complaint with it. The edges are very crisp and sharp. This isn't a HUGE deal but they are a little sharp and I could see someone not feeling that it was super comfortable. It doesn't usually bug me but occasionally it does feel a little sharp. It works good and is very precise though, laser mice work great on it.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: The Best mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: smooth texture and makes my mouse move faster. I would never think that a mouse pad could change my mouse performance sooo much. I will buy this pad again but I believe that won't be for a long while since this pad seems to have a low wear and tear compared to the other 3 pads I bought this past year. I would be happier if it was slightly larger and maybe had a smooth beveled edge, because the edge cuts into my wrist but that happens with all the pads I use
customer_reviews.author: reichenbach

customer_reviews.title: Simply Does Not Work For Me
customer_reviews.text: I had high hope for this mousepad but I ended up with a very disappointing product. The mouse simply does not track properly on this pad. Laggy, and impossible to use. The cursor on the screen tracks perfectly fine when I'm Not using this mousepad so I know the mouse works fine. Stick with traditional mousepads, trust me!
customer_reviews.author: matthew yale

customer_reviews.title: Probably the ideal mouse pad for optical / Laser Mice
customer_reviews.text: I always thought that the optical mice could work the same in any surface, until I faced an all white table. All my optical mice had errors and I couldn't think of why. Until in one of Amazon's recommendations suggested me this mouse pad and since it was at a good price, I decided to give it a shot. And what a difference, now all my optical mice fly.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto

customer_reviews.title: Get this if your mouse is going through batteries like Swiss cheese
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I was having trouble with my Logitech M310 mouse going through batteries quickly with my cloth mouse pad. It seems to have solved that problem, although diligence in turning the mouse off between uses would probably do just as well or better. It does take some getting used to the slicker surface, but I did notice the mousing accuracy is greatly improved with this pad. I'm not a gamer, so I can't vouch for higher body counts by switching to it.
customer_reviews.author: UltrasonicallyYours

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best mouse pad you can buy at any price, bar none!
customer_reviews.text: Simply the most practical, most durable, easiest to clean mouse pad you can buy. I'm not kidding. These are made with WAY better materials than any normal/standard mouse pad. I had one of 3M's early mouse pads that lasted thru years of hard use and neglect. This one looks to be made even more durable than the first 3M pad I owned. No flash, no fluff, just all business. Just buy it and clean it once in a while if it needs it and you won't even think about mouse pads again for years. These mouse pads perform great and they never stop working great, it's as simple as that.
customer_reviews.author: Blasthoff

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse pad. I don't know if it saves my battery life of my mouse or makes it more accurate but it works very well. One of my mice works poorly on most surfaces and mouse pads but it works perfectly on this pad. The pad is also very beautiful and thin making it easy to pack with you. It does have a very strong rubber smell that has yet to fade after 4 months; I have even left it out in the sun let it off gas and it has not helped.
customer_reviews.author: PlushPippin

customer_reviews.title: Great for precision, not so great for comfort
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says in that it gives you a surface that typical laser mice can track very precisely but it's not very comfortable on the skin and if your hand perhaps sweats a bit, it will not be absorbed but rather become a nuisance. I found I didn't care for it and replaced it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Lies flat, doesn't stink, works
customer_reviews.text: The bottom appears to be a layer of 1/8 inch neoprene foam laminated to a stiff slightly textured plastic top. Unlike many neoprene mousepads that have a cloth top, the plastic top seals in most of the steanch of the neoprene so it doesn't smell like a tire factory. I did not notice any differnce in the behavior of my rodent but I overall, I like the pad and bought several for other computers.
customer_reviews.author: x

customer_reviews.title: Edges are scratchy
customer_reviews.text: This pad provides a smooth and accurate glide but is very uncomfortable for extended use. There is virtually no cushioning nor wrist support. Also, the edge are rought so if your hand moves of the edges of the pad it will scratch against your palm. The cover pad should have curved over the edge or graduated it to the flat surface.
customer_reviews.author: Krane

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 3M mousepad as a Lightening Deal. I liked the inexpensive price for a 3M product. I was also intrigued by the claim that using it will conserve the battery in my mouse by up to 50%. Time will tell if this is actually true. Overall, like it, but be warned about the strong "plastic" smell of it right out of the box. It dissipated in a few days though. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: C Evans

customer_reviews.title: It is the best
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is probably the best one I have owned and I have owned many. They do the job well and do not get as dirty as most mouse pads do. Work great with wireless mice especially. Highly recommended, even though they may be a bit pricey, they are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight A. Lehman

customer_reviews.title: no change in wireless apple mouse
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my wireless apple mouse was skipping even after cleaning off the glass thing on the bottom. I didn't have a mousepad prior to this so I can't compare it to a non-3m mousepad, but I can say there is no change using this mousepad vs use the regular hardtop table. Not worth the money but also not worth the time/gas to bother returning.
customer_reviews.author: Luck3

customer_reviews.title: I bought two. This is a must for anyone!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse pad previously. You already know 3M products are on the top. My expectation was not wrong. Now I can feel the difference seriously. The mouse moves very smoothly and precisely on the pad. Right away, I ordered one more for my wife. My wife also loves it as well. Strongly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Snickers

customer_reviews.title: Makes using  mouse much easier!
customer_reviews.text: I had bought an ergonomic mouse, because of having carpal tunnel surgery in both hands, but I just could not make it move with a smooth glide. When I saw this mouse pad, it sounded like what I needed & sure enough it filled the bill. I can't really comment on the gaming aspect, because I'm not much of a gamer.....more like a recipe/pinterest user
customer_reviews.author: Beadwoman

customer_reviews.title: It's fine and it works
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why this was in industrial as I used to but optically accurate pads everywhere, but in pages of regular mousepads on Amazon I only found the cloth backed neoprene backed ones that are a dime a dozen before I got tired of searching. Nothing magical here, but its better tracking, thin, and lasts longer,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Same problems as other reviews
customer_reviews.text: The good: *Claims to save battery power *Sticks to non-glass surfaces well The bad: *Surface is very slick. It's textured to a point that you can feel it, but not enough to impede a mouse at all. This results in insignificant movement causing mis-clicks. *This is undoubtedly made in a large sheet and then cut by an extremely fine blade. The edges are nearly sharp enough to cut yourself on.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: The mouse pad is marketed as being "precise" due to the markings on the surface, but my laser mouse doesn't respond very well to this mouse pad. The pad it rigid and has a non slip surface on the bottom, so it stays in place very well and provides an excellent mousing surface.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Cape

customer_reviews.title: After nine months it's unreliable at best
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mat for nine months. It has now developed a smooth area in the center (where most of mouse movement occurs), and in this area the cursor tracking is very poor. It will track the mouse at the edge, but when you hit that slick area there's no cursor movement. When new it was great, but now it's virtually useless. It gets 2 stars because initially it was great, but I expected more than nine months of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hillyer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a good product.
customer_reviews.text: Really excellent product. Smooth matte texture, sort of a hard plastic/teflon material. From the picture it looks like it has little triangle indents but that's just the printed pattern. I can't speak to the claims of increased battery life because I have a wired mouse, but it does help with accuracy and prevents your cursor from jittering like it would if you used a cloth mouse pad or just put it right on the desk/table surface. It's a good size, plenty big enough but not too big. Don't fold it or the top will crack/crease. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: Not for daily work use
customer_reviews.text: I am a CAD designer, so I use the mouse all the time. I have this pad one month and it’s useless. The texture worn off. It was absolutely great in the beginning, so I guess it would work perfectly for someone who uses the computer only occasionally. Unfortunately didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Schreibert

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using PC mice for years with little problems, but this magic mouse from Apple is one fickle mouse. And I fail to see how it's SO much better and so magic. I went through several pads (the metal one worked okay but was so cold in th winter and then seemed to hinder the mouse). This pad works great out of the gate.
customer_reviews.author: nacnud

customer_reviews.title: Sticky.
customer_reviews.text: Have to return this as the mouse has a jerky movement on this surface. Not at all smooth rolling. My mouse is new, I've cleaned the pad several times, and after a very short time, it feels sticky again. I don't like this at all. I really dislike having to return items.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Just a usual mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it thinking its something out of the ordinary. Dont get me wrong, its comfortable and looks/matches well with my mac, however not something out of the ordinary. Any mouse pad will give you a similar feel and comfort I believe. I am keeping it since i like the color. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Hassaan

customer_reviews.title: improved performance resulting in improved usability of optical mice, made in USA
customer_reviews.text: First, this is a product that's made in the USA (or, at least, my example was), which is a nice surprise these days. Second, there's significant improvement in the performance of my wireless optical mice (Apple Magic Mouse, Logitech Cordless Click!) when using this 3M mouse pad over a traditional black fabric mouse pad that I've used for a few years. This improvement has made a very positive difference in the usability of my computers. Whether this product actually improves the battery life of my mice remains to be seen. However, for what you do get for the price (just over $7 in my case), the value for your money is very hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Ashram

customer_reviews.title: Really faster mouse
customer_reviews.text: The product description says that it helps your optical mouse work better. I didn't believe it. Bought it for the price. OMG! It does make my mouse respond faster. The surface is fast and the mouse needs less movement to get the pointer where it needs to be. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jacobson

product_meta.title: 3M Precise Mouse Pad Enhances the Precision of Optical Mice at Fast Speeds and Extends the Battery Life of Wireless Mice up to 50%, 9 in x 8 in (MP114-BSD1)
product_meta.description: Size:9" x 8"| Style:StandardPrecise surface enhances the precision of optical mice at fast speeds. Battery saving design extends battery life of wireless mice up to 50%*. Foam mouse pad with non-skid backing keeps mouse pad in place, 9" x 8" with Bitmap design. MP114-BSD1
feature_bullets: Precise surface enhances the precision of optical mice at fast speeds
Battery saving design extends battery life of wireless mice up to 50%*
Foam mouse pad with non-skid backing keeps mouse pad in place
*These products draw less current than darker mousing surfaces, which results in extended battery life

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,283 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
